name: View Compliance Record Detail
description: Alliant Admin can click the View button to navigate to a detailed compliance record page showing complete compliance information including all requirement statuses

background.text: I am logged in as an Alliant Admin
I am on the Compliance Dashboard list view

scenarios.name: Successfully navigate to Compliance Record Detail page

steps.text: I can see compliance records in the list view
I click the View button for a compliance record
I should be navigated to the Compliance Record Detail page
the page header should display "Compliance Record Detail"
the page should be displayed in read-only mode

scenarios.name: View compliant record with all requirements met

steps.text: there is a compliance record with all requirements compliant
I click the View button for that record
I should see the overall status as "Compliant" with a green badge
all individual requirements should show "Compliant" status with green badges

scenarios.name: View non-compliant record with some requirements not met

steps.text: there is a compliance record with at least one non-compliant requirement
I click the View button for that record
I should see the overall status as "Non-Compliant" with a red badge
non-compliant requirements should show "Non-Compliant" status with red badges
compliant requirements should show "Compliant" status with green badges
I am viewing a compliance record detail page
I should see the contractor's full name displayed as "First Name Last Name"
I should see the Company Name populated from Focus
I should see the Contractor ID populated from Focus
I should see the Email ID populated from Focus

scenarios.name: View all insurance requirements with proper status display

steps.text: I am viewing a compliance record detail page
I should see the Requirements section with "Requirement" and "Status" columns
I should see "Scheduled or Owned Auto" requirement with its status
I should see "VIN Listed" requirement with its status
I should see "Hired" requirement with its status
I should see all other insurance requirements listed with their respective statuses

scenarios.name: Successfully navigate back to Compliance Dashboard

steps.text: I am viewing a compliance record detail page
I click the Back navigation button
I should be returned to the Compliance Dashboard list view
I should see the list of compliance records

scenarios.name: View record with missing contractor information

steps.text: there is a compliance record with incomplete contractor information
I click the View button for that record
I should still be able to view the compliance record detail page
missing fields should be displayed as empty or with appropriate placeholders
available information should still be displayed correctly

scenarios.name: Attempt to edit fields in read-only mode

steps.text: I am viewing a compliance record detail page
I attempt to click on any field to edit it
the fields should remain read-only and not editable
no editing options should be available

scenarios.name: View record with network connectivity issues

steps.text: I have limited network connectivity
I click the View button for a compliance record
I should see an appropriate error message if the page fails to load
I should have the option to retry loading the page

scenarios.name: View record with invalid or corrupted data

steps.text: there is a compliance record with corrupted requirement data
I click the View button for that record
I should see an error message indicating data issues
corrupted requirements should show an unknown or error status
valid requirements should still display correctly

scenarios.name: View record with maximum number of requirements

steps.text: there is a compliance record with all possible requirements
I click the View button for that record
all requirements should be displayed correctly
the page should handle the display of all requirements without performance issues
scrolling should work properly if requirements exceed page height

scenarios.name: View record with minimum required data

steps.text: there is a compliance record with only minimum required data
I click the View button for that record
the page should display successfully with minimal information
empty or unavailable fields should be handled gracefully
the overall compliance status should still be calculated correctly

scenarios.name: Navigate using browser back button instead of Back navigation

steps.text: I am viewing a compliance record detail page
I click the browser back button
I should be returned to the Compliance Dashboard list view
the application state should be maintained correctly

scenarios.name: View record by direct URL access

steps.text: I have a direct URL to a compliance record detail page
I navigate directly to that URL
I should see the compliance record detail page
all information should be displayed correctly
the Back navigation button should still work properly

gherkin_content:
Feature: View Compliance Record Detail
  Alliant Admin can click the View button to navigate to a detailed compliance record page showing complete compliance information including all requirement statuses

  Background:
    Given I am on the application
    And I am logged in as an Alliant Admin
    And I am on the Compliance Dashboard list view

  @smoke @positive
  Scenario: Successfully navigate to Compliance Record Detail page
    Given I can see compliance records in the list view
    When I click the View button for a compliance record
    Then I should be navigated to the Compliance Record Detail page
    And the page header should display "Compliance Record Detail"
    And the page should be displayed in read-only mode

  @positive
  Scenario: View compliant record with all requirements met
    Given there is a compliance record with all requirements compliant
    When I click the View button for that record
    Then I should see the overall status as "Compliant" with a green badge
    And all individual requirements should show "Compliant" status with green badges

  @positive
  Scenario: View non-compliant record with some requirements not met
    Given there is a compliance record with at least one non-compliant requirement
    When I click the View button for that record
    Then I should see the overall status as "Non-Compliant" with a red badge
    And non-compliant requirements should show "Non-Compliant" status with red badges
    And compliant requirements should show "Compliant" status with green badges

  @positive
  Scenario: Display auto-populated contractor information
    Given I am viewing a compliance record detail page
    Then I should see the contractor's full name displayed as "First Name Last Name"
    And I should see the Company Name populated from Focus
    And I should see the Contractor ID populated from Focus
    And I should see the Email ID populated from Focus

  @positive
  Scenario: View all insurance requirements with proper status display
    Given I am viewing a compliance record detail page
    Then I should see the Requirements section with "Requirement" and "Status" columns
    And I should see "Scheduled or Owned Auto" requirement with its status
    And I should see "VIN Listed" requirement with its status
    And I should see "Hired" requirement with its status
    And I should see all other insurance requirements listed with their respective statuses

  @positive
  Scenario: Successfully navigate back to Compliance Dashboard
    Given I am viewing a compliance record detail page
    When I click the Back navigation button
    Then I should be returned to the Compliance Dashboard list view
    And I should see the list of compliance records

  @negative
  Scenario: View record with missing contractor information
    Given there is a compliance record with incomplete contractor information
    When I click the View button for that record
    Then I should still be able to view the compliance record detail page
    And missing fields should be displayed as empty or with appropriate placeholders
    But available information should still be displayed correctly

  @negative
  Scenario: Attempt to edit fields in read-only mode
    Given I am viewing a compliance record detail page
    When I attempt to click on any field to edit it
    Then the fields should remain read-only and not editable
    And no editing options should be available

  @negative
  Scenario: View record with network connectivity issues
    Given I have limited network connectivity
    When I click the View button for a compliance record
    Then I should see an appropriate error message if the page fails to load
    And I should have the option to retry loading the page

  @negative
  Scenario: View record with invalid or corrupted data
    Given there is a compliance record with corrupted requirement data
    When I click the View button for that record
    Then I should see an error message indicating data issues
    And corrupted requirements should show an unknown or error status
    But valid requirements should still display correctly

  @edge-case @boundary
  Scenario: View record with maximum number of requirements
    Given there is a compliance record with all possible requirements
    When I click the View button for that record
    Then all requirements should be displayed correctly
    And the page should handle the display of all requirements without performance issues
    And scrolling should work properly if requirements exceed page height

  @edge-case @boundary
  Scenario: View record with minimum required data
    Given there is a compliance record with only minimum required data
    When I click the View button for that record
    Then the page should display successfully with minimal information
    And empty or unavailable fields should be handled gracefully
    And the overall compliance status should still be calculated correctly

  @alternative-flow
  Scenario: Navigate using browser back button instead of Back navigation
    Given I am viewing a compliance record detail page
    When I click the browser back button
    Then I should be returned to the Compliance Dashboard list view
    And the application state should be maintained correctly

  @alternative-flow
  Scenario: View record by direct URL access
    Given I have a direct URL to a compliance record detail page
    When I navigate directly to that URL
    Then I should see the compliance record detail page
    And all information should be displayed correctly
    And the Back navigation button should still work properly
